medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started abruptly with intractable nausea. Patient has been unable to tolerate oral intake, including medications, due to vomiting. On admission, she reported 6 episodes of non-bloody, bilious emesis and several episodes of diarrhea per day. No abdominal discomfort except with vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus, Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, Hyperlipidemia, Asthma, Hypothyroidism, Vitamin D deficiency, Allergic rhinitis.
medical_history.family_history: Father: Unknown; Mother: Diabetes mellitus; 2 Maternal aunts with breast cancer.
